content.raw:
Hi,
I was trying to read a .pep.xml file by DataFrame, but I constantly got the same error.

My code:

```
#!python
...
a=pepxml.read("interact.pep.xml")
b=pepxml.DataFrame(a)
...
```

Error:


```
#!

Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "InteractPepXMLParser.py", line 20, in <module>
    b=pepxml.DataFrame(a)
  File "C:\Users\Armin\AppData\Local\Programs\Python\Python36\lib\site-packages\pyteomics\pepxml.py", line 412, in DataFrame
    return pd.DataFrame(gen_items(), **pd_kwargs)
  File "C:\Users\Armin\AppData\Local\Programs\Python\Python36\lib\site-packages\pandas\core\frame.py", line 382, in __init__
    data = list(data)
  File "C:\Users\Armin\AppData\Local\Programs\Python\Python36\lib\site-packages\pyteomics\pepxml.py", line 406, in gen_items
    info.update(ar['peptideprophet_result']['parameter'])
KeyError: 'parameter'
```


This happened after I changed some of my PeptideProphet settings. (The function works fine for some sort of settings.) I should mention that pepxml.filter works fine in every situation.
Could you please help me?
content.html:
Hi, I was trying to read a .pep.xml file by DataFrame, but I constantly got the same error.

My code:

...
a=pepxml.read("interact.pep.xml")
b=pepxml.DataFrame(a)
...

Error:

Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "InteractPepXMLParser.py", line 20, in <module>
    b=pepxml.DataFrame(a)
  File "C:\Users\Armin\AppData\Local\Programs\Python\Python36\lib\site-packages\pyteomics\pepxml.py", line 412, in DataFrame
    return pd.DataFrame(gen_items(), **pd_kwargs)
  File "C:\Users\Armin\AppData\Local\Programs\Python\Python36\lib\site-packages\pandas\core\frame.py", line 382, in __init__
    data = list(data)
  File "C:\Users\Armin\AppData\Local\Programs\Python\Python36\lib\site-packages\pyteomics\pepxml.py", line 406, in gen_items
    info.update(ar['peptideprophet_result']['parameter'])
KeyError: 'parameter'

This happened after I changed some of my PeptideProphet settings. (The function works fine for some sort of settings.) I should mention that pepxml.filter works fine in every situation. Could you please help me?
